description:
Provides a resource to configure lb tcp monitor on NSX-T manager

~> **NOTE:** This resource requires NSX version 2.3 or higher.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

DisplayName.description: The display name of this resource. Defaults to ID if not set.

FallCount.description: Number of consecutive checks must fail before marking it down.

Interval.description: The frequency at which the system issues the monitor check (in seconds).

MonitorPort.description: If the monitor port is specified, it would override pool member port setting for healthcheck. Port range is not supported.

Receive.description: Expected data, if specified, can be anywhere in the response and it has to be a string, regular expressions are not supported.

RiseCount.description: Number of consecutive checks must pass before marking it up.

Send.description: Payload to send out to the monitored server. If both send and receive are not specified, then just a TCP connection is established (3-way handshake) to validate server is healthy, no data is sent.

Timeout.description: Number of seconds the target has in which to respond to the monitor request.
